intro: Sparganium borderi, commonly known as the narrowleaf bur-reed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces cylindrical, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, reddish-brown flowers. Sparganium borderi typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
